p:
Spirooxindoles 6a–p were evaluated for their anti-proliferative potency towards HepG2 liver cancer and PC-3 prostate cancer cell lines. Both cells lines were cultured as monolayers in DMEM supplemented with 10% foetal bovine serum (FBS), L-glutamine (2 mM), penicillin (100 U/mL) and streptomycin sulphate (100 µg/mL). Then, cells were sub-cultured with trypsine/EDTA solution, counted with haemocytometer and plated onto 96-well plates (5000 cells/well) and left overnight so as to form a semi-confluent monolayer. A modified method was employed utilising the (3-[4,5-dimethylthiazol-2-yl] − 2,5-diphenyltetrazolium bromide (MTT) dye, as reported earlier
25–27 . IC 50 values were calculated using non-linear regression curve fitting of the dose response plots on GraphPad Prism V.6.0 software. Assessment of morphological changes of HepG2 cells after treatment with the active compounds 6a, 6e and 6i were carried out by phase contrast inverted microscope (Ziess, USA) and photomicrographs were taken using digital camera.
